metricId.name: CoreArtifactCount
metricId.description: Number of active architecture artifacts

metricId.name: CoreEmptyArtifactCount
metricId.description: Number of active architecture artifacts that are empty

metricId.name: CoreIgnoredViolationsParserDependencies
metricId.description: Number of parser dependencies in ignored architecture violations

metricId.name: CoreUnassignedComponents
metricId.description: Number of components that are not assigned to any artifact

metricId.name: CoreViolatingComponents
metricId.description: Number of components that contain architecture violations

metricId.name: CoreViolationsComponents
metricId.description: Number of component dependency relations that violate an active architecture model

metricId.name: CoreViolationsParserDependencies
metricId.description: Number of parser dependencies in architecture violations

metricId.name: CoreComponentDependenciesToRemoveComponents
metricId.description: Number of component dependencies to remove to break up all non-ignored component cycles

metricId.name: CoreDuplicatedLines
metricId.description: Number of duplicated lines in non-ignored duplicated code blocks.

metricId.name: CoreDuplicates
metricId.description: Number of duplicated code blocks.

metricId.name: CoreIgnoredDuplicates
metricId.description: Number of ignored duplicated code blocks.

metricId.name: CoreIgnoredThresholdViolations
metricId.description: Number of ignored threshold violations.

metricId.name: CoreParserDependenciesToRemoveComponents
metricId.description: Number of code lines to change to break up all non-ignored component cycles.

metricId.name: CoreStructuralDebtIndexComponents
metricId.description: Cummulative structural debt index of non-ignored component cycles.

metricId.name: CoreThresholdViolations
metricId.description: Number of non-ignored threshold violations.

metricId.name: JavaComponentDependenciesToRemovePackages
metricId.description: Number of component dependencies to remove to break up all non-ignored package cycles.

metricId.name: JavaParserDependenciesToRemovePackages
metricId.description: Number of code lines to change to break up all non-ignored package cycles.

metricId.name: JavaStructuralDebtIndexPackages
metricId.description: Cummulative structural debt index of non-ignored package cycles.

metricId.name: CoreBiggestComponentCycleGroup
metricId.description: Number of components in biggest cycle.

metricId.name: CoreComponentCycleGroups
metricId.description: Number of component cycles.

metricId.name: CoreCyclicComponents
metricId.description: Number of components involved in cycles.

metricId.name: CoreCyclicityComponents
metricId.description: Cummulated cyclicity of component cycles.

metricId.name: CoreIgnoredCyclicComponents
metricId.description: Number of components involved in ignored cycles.

metricId.name: CoreRelativeCyclicityComponents
metricId.description: Relative component cyclicity in percent.

metricId.name: JavaBiggestPackageCycleGroup
metricId.description: Biggest package cycle.

metricId.name: JavaCyclicPackages
metricId.description: Number of cyclic packages.

metricId.name: JavaCyclicityPackages
metricId.description: Cummulated cyclicity of package cycles.

metricId.name: JavaIgnoredCyclicPackages
metricId.description: Number of ignored cyclic packages.

metricId.name: JavaPackageCycleGroups
metricId.description: Number of package cycle groups.

metricId.name: JavaRelativeCyclicityPackages
metricId.description: Relative package cyclicity in percent.

metricId.name: CoreLcom4
metricId.description: Determines the number of components in a class (anonymous classes are not considered). A component is composed of fields, methods and types defined top level including all their nested programming elements. Constructors, destructors, empty, abstract and overridden methods of classes are not included in the calculation. The metric represents the unrelated portions of code in a class. A value of 1 indicates the highest cohesion possible - which is normally desirable. High values might indicate that a class is a candidate for a refactoring. Consider that utility classes by nature have high LCOM4 values.

metricId.name: CoreLogicalCohesionModule
metricId.description: Number of dependencies 'to' and 'from' other top-level logical programming elements in the same namespace on module level.

metricId.name: CoreLogicalCohesionSystem
metricId.description: Number of dependencies 'to' and 'from' other top-level logical programming elements in the same namespace on system level.

metricId.name: CoreLogicalCouplingModule
metricId.description: Number of dependencies 'to' and 'from' other top-level logical programming elements in other namespaces on module level.

metricId.name: CoreLogicalCouplingSystem
metricId.description: Number of dependencies 'to' and 'from' other top-level logical programming elements in other namespaces on system level.

metricId.name: CorePhysicalCohesion
metricId.description: Number of dependencies 'to' and 'from' other components in the same module.

metricId.name: CorePhysicalCoupling
metricId.description: Number of dependencies 'to' and 'from' other components in other modules.

metricId.name: CoreCodeCommentLines
metricId.description: Counts all comment lines excluding header comments.

metricId.name: CoreCommentLines
metricId.description: Counts all comment lines.

metricId.name: CoreComponents
metricId.description: Number of components.

metricId.name: CoreLinesOfCode
metricId.description: Lines of code excluding blank and comment lines.

metricId.name: CoreMethods
metricId.description: Number of member functions.

metricId.name: CoreParameters
metricId.description: Number of parameters.

metricId.name: CoreSourceElementCount
metricId.description: Number of programming elements (i.e. types, fields, methods, functions, ...) plus number of statements.

metricId.name: CoreStatements
metricId.description: Counts all statements.

metricId.name: CoreTotalLines
metricId.description: Counts all lines including empty and comment lines.

metricId.name: CoreTypesModule
metricId.description: Number of types (classes, enums or similar, excluding anonymous types) in container on module level.

metricId.name: CoreTypesSystem
metricId.description: Number of types (classes, enums or similar, excluding anonymous types) in container on system level.

metricId.name: JavaByteCodeInstructions
metricId.description: Number of Java byte code instructions.

metricId.name: JavaPackages
metricId.description: Number of packages containing types.

metricId.name: CoreAcd
metricId.description: Average component dependency according to John Lakos. Average number of components a component depends on directly and indirectly. This metric can be used to characterize the overall average coupling of internal components.

metricId.name: CoreCcd
metricId.description: Cumulative component dependency according to John Lakos. Cumulated depends upon values.

metricId.name: CoreDependsUponModule
metricId.description: Depends upon module level according to DependsOn by John Lakos. Total number of components that a component directly and indirectly depends upon in containing module.

metricId.name: CoreDependsUponSystem
metricId.description: Depends upon system level according to DependsOn by John Lakos. Total number of components that a component directly and indirectly depends upon in system.

metricId.name: CoreMaxAcd
metricId.description: Highest ACD value among same elements.

metricId.name: CoreNccd
metricId.description: Normalized cumulative component dependency according to John Lakos. The ratio between the cumulative component dependency and the cumulative component dependency of a balanced binary tree of the same size. A value greater than 1 indicates a more vertical design. A value less than 1 indicates a more horizontal design.

metricId.name: CoreRacd
metricId.description: Relative average component dependency. Average component dependency divided by the number of internal components multiplied by 100 (in percent).

metricId.name: CoreUsedFromModule
metricId.description: Number of all depending elements (direct and indirect) + 1 (including self) in containing module.

metricId.name: CoreUsedFromSystem
metricId.description: Number of all depending elements (direct and indirect) + 1 (including self) in system.

metricId.name: CoreAbstractnessModule
metricId.description: Abstractness according to Robert C. Martin based on module level dependencies. Total number of abstract types divided by the total number of concrete types. The metric has a range of [0,1]. 0 means that the container contains no abstract types. 1 means that the container contains nothing but abstract types.

metricId.name: CoreAbstractnessSystem
metricId.description: Abstractness according to Robert C. Martin based on system level dependencies. Total number of abstract types divided by the total number of concrete types. The metric has a range of [0,1]. 0 means that the container contains no abstract types. 1 means that the container contains nothing but abstract types.

metricId.name: CoreDistanceModule
metricId.description: Distance according to Robert C. Martin based on module level dependencies. Abstractness + Instability - 1. The metric has a range of [-1,1]. This is a variation of the original metric definition. A negative sign means 'in the zone of pain' and a positive sign means 'in the zone of uselessness'. A 'good' value should be around 0.

metricId.name: CoreDistanceSystem
metricId.description: Distance according to Robert C. Martin based on system level dependencies. Abstractness + Instability - 1. The metric has a range of [-1,1]. This is a variation of the original metric definition. A negative sign means 'in the zone of pain' and a positive sign means 'in the zone of uselessness'. A 'good' value should be around 0.

metricId.name: CoreIncomingDependenciesModule
metricId.description: Number of incoming dependencies on module level.

metricId.name: CoreIncomingDependenciesSystem
metricId.description: Number of incoming dependencies on system level.

metricId.name: CoreInstabilityModule
metricId.description: Instability according to Robert C. Martin based on module level dependencies. The metric has a range of [0,1]. If there are no outgoing dependencies, then the Instability will be 0 and the measured element is stable. If there are no incoming dependencies, then the Instability will be 1 and the measured element is instable. Stable means that the element is not so easy to be changed. Instable means that it is easier to be changed.

metricId.name: CoreInstabilitySysytem
metricId.description: Instability according to Robert C. Martin based on system level dependencies. The metric has a range of [0,1]. If there are no outgoing dependencies, then I will be 0 and the measured element is stable. If there are no incoming dependencies, then I will be 1 and the measured element is instable. Stable means that the element is not so easy to be changed. Instable means that it is easier to be changed.

metricId.name: CoreOutgoingDependenciesModule
metricId.description: Number of outgoing dependencies on module level.

metricId.name: CoreOutgoingDependenciesSystem
metricId.description: Number of outgoing dependencies on system level.

metricId.name: CoreCcn
metricId.description: Cyclomatic complexity according to Thomas J. McCabe. Number of decision points in a method plus one for the method entry.

metricId.name: CoreExtendedCcn
metricId.description: As cyclomatic complexity adding the number of logical '&&' and '||' operations.

metricId.name: CoreModifiedCcn
metricId.description: As cyclomatic complexity but switch statements only add 1 independent from the number of cases.

metricId.name: CoreModifiedExtendedCcn
metricId.description: As cyclomatic complexity but switch statements only add 1 independent from the number of cases and adding the number of logical '&&' and '||' operations.

metricId.name: Unused Types
metricId.description: Number of types with no incoming references
